description: New Latin, from French urée, from Ancient Greek οὖρον (oûron, “urine”).

entries.meaning: (organic chemistry, uncountable) A water-soluble organic compound, CO(NH2)2, formed by the metabolism of proteins and excreted in the urine.
(chemistry, countable) Any N-substituted derivative of urea, with the general formula (R1R2N)CO(NR3R4).
